tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Tough Grader (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: More than fair. Difficult course. Just be sure to take him as close to your first semester of ACCT because the information never stops building. Do not fall behind or it\'s very difficult to catch up.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Tough Grader (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
stu_tags: SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  PARTICIPATION MATTERS
comments: A lot of people find this class hard, but I found that as long as you go to class and do the practice problems you will pass. He will even bump up your grade if you are on the cusp and he knows you attend class.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Tough Grader (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Crazy class. I took him over summer and it was brutal. It was my second time taking Acct 301 and the things he taught and the exercise we did was so deep I felt like i had never seen this material. He makes it harder than it has to be and his exams are extra crazy where M/c questions are tricky and journal entries its very rare to get partial credi

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Tough Grader (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: I absolutely hate accounting. Professor Warne makes you work for your grade, he\'s a no nonsense kind of guy. BUT he truly wants you to learn and do well. If you show up to class and put in effort you will pass. Make sure you do well on the first two exams. The final is brutal! Overall, take him - I\'m glad I did.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Tough Grader (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Unless you put in the effort to pass accounting, this class is indeed difficult. Professor Warne cares about his students, so you should take advantage of that. I remember that he even changed around the weighted average for the first two exams and the final just so his incompetent students could have another chance. Great professor.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Tough Grader (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Great professor if you are an accounting major. He\'s tough, but he knows his stuff and will prepare you well for higher acct classes. But if you aren\'t an accounting major this class will be super hard.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Tough Grader (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Prof Warren is an EXTREMELY fair professor. Guy literally does the filtering of the knowledge necessary of his class and puts the important stuff on PP. Very good guy as a person. Good stories as an auditor (Auditing Utah Prison). Guy writes CPA problems for AICPA. Very smart dude. Cares for students and is a great guy. Would have a beer with him.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Tough Grader (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: He is a decent teacher, capable of explaining things. He needs to improve presenting rules & concepts cohesively; not disparate and disjointed. Sure, he will explain, reiterating the rule\'s application.. Next point! As for exam: Disproportionately involved questions but not so sophisticated teaching. High standards. :D For BOTH sides, no? ` : \xe2\x80\x93 )

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Tough Grader (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Nice professor, if you are accounting major, please take him. He is very knowledgeable about the materials. His exams not hard but condense. You have to really study in order to pass. He will do his best to give you the highest grade at the end of the semester. So do your best in the Final. I got B.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Tough Grader (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: He is not a good teacher. He expects you to know the material on your own. He has PowerPoint slides, but he basically just reads from them. He does some problems in class, but likes to send out worksheets and just give the answers the next day without explanation. I would take someone else if you have the chance. He\'s nice, but not helpful.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Tough Grader (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: His tests are hard, and sometimes he makes mistakes on the questions, causing a lot of confusion while taking the test. He seems to know the material pretty well, but doesn\'t quite relay what he wants for the exam, making the tests harder than they should be.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Tough Grader (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: He is very helpful if you ask questions. It\'s very helpful if you read the chapter before attend the class.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Tough Grader (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: If you are an accounting major please take him, you won\'t regret. his tests are little hard (it is accounting, what do you expect) but if you do the Connect homework and also his in class practice problems you should do just fine. He is super helpful, However, you have to earn your grade. Highly recommended :)

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Tough Grader (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: I think ppl are being a little tough on him. He\'s a nice guy and really knows his stuff. This is my 2nd time taking Acct 301 and he\'s the better of the professors I\'ve taken it from. Acct 301 is just a really hard course. His tests are more straight forward than my last professor\'s tests, and none of the Acct profs I\'ve seen give partial credit.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Tough Grader (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Good professor but he is hard. I had passed my two previous acct courses with A\'s and then I went to his class. I studied my butt off and failed the first exam, barely passed the second and final. Needless to say, I hade to take it again...but with a different professor, who was just as good and actually stuck with the material he was teaching.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Tough Grader (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Great professor, very clear with his lectures, but the class material can be very challenging. He is not a big fan of partial credit, or making exceptions for specific cases. His 3 tests are very challenging, but are easy if you spend time studying. He is helpful and wants you to succeed, but is fair and will make you work for it.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Tough Grader (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: He\'s not an easy professor, but he is very knowledgable and helpful. In my opinion, students usually fail his classes because they fail to read the textbook that every single student is required to do before coming to school. If you plan to take the CPA exam in the future, I\'ll definitely recommend you to take his classes.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Tough Grader (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: He is very strict in grading and won\'t give partial credit. He\'s not very helpful. Pay attention to his in-class problems and attend to class if you want to pass his class.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Tough Grader (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  Respected (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: This professor knows Accounting very well. However, your grade only consists of 3 exams and homework, which is only 5% of your grade. If you do bad on one exam it could change your grade drastically. His homework and his in-class activities are not like his exams. His exams are very tricky, half the class failed. I would not recommend taking him.
